source.name: Golf Courses
source.description: The New York State Office of Parks, Recreation and Historic Preservation oversees 179 state parks and 35 historic sites, which are visited by 60 million people annually. The New York State Office of Parks operates 29 golf courses throughout New York State. From the famed Bethpage Black, home to the 2002 and 2009 U.S. Open Golf Championship, to the rolling terrain of the Robert Trent Jones' designed 18-hole course at Green Lakes State Park, New York's state park golf courses rank among the best public courses in the world.

datasets.name: Golf Courses Map
datasets.description: This point map provides the locations of the 29 golf courses operated by The New York State Office of Parks. By clicking on the blue points on the point map, users are provided the name of a golf course, a link to the web page for that location and the option of viewing the details for that point from the associated dataset and/or opening a page in Google Maps for that location. Users may also use the next buttons, which appear at the bottom of the page after selecting 'details,' to find and view other golf courses.
